nodes.caption:
I have often thought that with any luck at all I could have been born a werewolf, because the two middle fingers on both my hands are the same length, but I have had to be content with what I had.
-
I was wondering about my eyes; one of my eyes–-the left–-saw everything golden and yellow and orange, and the other eye saw shades of blue and grey and green; perhaps one eye was for daylight and the other was for night. If everyone in the world saw different colors from different eyes there might be a great many new colors still to be invented.
-
All cat stories start with this statement: "My mother, who was the first cat, told me this...
-
All quotes from "We Have Always Lived in the Castle" by Shirley Jackson
-
Illustration by Cristiana Couceiro; Source: Frances Benjamin Johnston / Library of Congress (House)
-
#shirleyjackson #fiction #novel #book #writer #writing #prose

@Regrann from @tylerdoll -  Quoted from the link in my bio... "We are a #sovereign people. How can we be held as assets for a debt which wasn’t real? We can’t – at least not LAWfully. We can however, be tricked into believing that we are responsible for the debt by transforming us into accommodation parties to a fictional entity (#strawman) created by the government. In a circuitous and scathingly brilliant marketing scheme, we were led to believe that we were who we were NOT and that we must work to earn funds in order to pay a debt which not only is not one which we ourselves incurred but also is a DEBT WHICH INCREASES BY OUR VERY WORKING TO PAY IT. Please stop 'working for a living'." #spiritual #economics #freeyourmind #money #debt #slavery #healthyself #wakeup #itwasalladream #fiction #dowhatyoulove #courage #peace #truth #love - #regrann

Silence had a freedom that no thought could equal because a sound made no absolute claim on meaning. Any word, on the other hand, could be forced to signify it's opposite.
- Do Not Say We Have Nothing, Madeleine Thien 📸 @tcrossau

#BookishMayFlowers #Day18z Favorite classic.
___

Confession: I want to be one of those people who reads a bunch of the classics. I really do. But the old fashioned language tends to take me out of the story and causes me to get bored. Do any of you guys have this problem and have found a way around it? 
___

Anyway, I was assigned this in an English class in college and It's been one of my favorite books since.

Day 9: Auto buy authors

I would say in all my collection the only author I currently buy books without reading the description is Rick Riordan, I love the Percy Jackson books so much I had to buy the Heroes of Olympus when they came out. But I am trying to diversify in terms as authors go, so is there any book that you recommend me?? Please comment your suggestion.

What is your favorite auto buy author?

So first of all, I know I haven't done this challenge in like a week but I am going to be posting the days I have missed.

Hey bookstagram!❤️I'm sorry again for being less active this last week, i've just been sick😷But I have a little more energy now so hopefully I'll start posting more now, I can't stay away from this amazing community for too long!📚
✨
Here are some nice creepy books that are on my horror shelves; i've been dying to read them😏Im still reading ACOWAR because as you know i'm the slowest reader ever, but i'm working on it. I may listen to the audiobook today and switch between that and reading the actual book, I love the narrators voice😝She makes the perfect Feyre!
✨
Since i'm still far from 100% feeling better, I plan on having another lazy day of reading and catching up on PLL and Bates Motel (i'm soo behind!) But let's be honest.. I tend to spend my days like that even when I'm not sick😉
✨
Question: what is a book that stuck with you because it was shocking or upsetting? (whether you liked the book or not). For me, I would have to say Living Dead Girl. I did really like the book, but it was highly disturbing. It was eye opening and important but it was very shocking and hard to forget. I read it last summer and it still sticks out as one of the most unforgettable books I've ever read☕️
✨
✨
✨
✨
✨

Yes, I do have an illuatrated encyclopedia of dinosaur species. Don't you? Doesn't everyone?! .
.
.
Im a little bit of a dinosaur fan, if you couldnt tell, and I'm so so happy to have received this velociraptor pin in May's @the.nocturnal.readers.box -
.
.
.
I'm so in love with Jurrasic Park I could write you a thousand sonnets about Dr. Ian Malcolm, DNA, mosquitoes stuck in amber, and why you shouldn't try to snuggle with a velociraptor. It would be a best seller, I'm sure of it. 😂
.
.
.
Let your nerd flag (or in this case, pin) fly! Are you too a Jurassic Park fan?! Who is your favorite character? .
.
.
Mine is Dr. Ian Malcolm, because of the definitive snark and because of  his scientific views (biology grad over here 🖑) .
.
.
Have a great Wednesday! .
.
.
.
.
.
The June Stephen King themed box is sold out! (Didn't I tell you it would go fast?) But for reference, my @the.nocturnal.readers.box discount code is: NOCTURNALBEX .
.
.
.

Spent an amazing morning with the @vancitybusinessbabes and @megandubs from @theselfpublishingagency, talking all about how to change your writer status to author. I was delighted to speak about the importance of social media through the journey.
.

Afterwards, I had a delightful coffee date with Megan, the author of Our Interrupted Fairytale, which is the true story of her life and relationship with a man who passed away too young.
.

If you're interested in picking up Our Interrupted Fairytale, a book with a 4.23 rating on @goodreads, you can visit Megan's website through the direct link in my bio (or here-> https://goo.gl/eQWN1E) for 10% off using the code sweptaway. I can't wait to read Our Interrupted Fairytale.
.

Hope everyone's Tuesday has been as amazing as mine! Thank you to @vancitybusinessbabes for this amazing opportunity 🙌🏻.
.

| Dead Man's Chest (behind the scenes)

FINALLY received my beautiful art by @charliebowater. It's even more gorgeous in person!!! Still not over ACOWAR, I have too many feelings about everything that happened! • • •

If you had to stick with reading only one genre what one would it be?
Since last year I have been venturing all over in the genres I read. I honestly enjoy them all. If I had to pick one though I'd go with fantasy. My first instinct is to say romance but there's usually some romance in fantasy books so I'll go with fantasy. 
@secretsafebooks makes these clever book safes. I've been storing bookmarks and hiding candy in mine 😂

HELLO BOOKSTAGRAM I HAVE MISSED YOU. 😄 What's your TBR for the month of May? 📚
~
It's only been 3 days, but lots has happened. I'm actually in a different state right now if anyone saw my instagram story yesterday 😂 I'm hoping to keep up with my reading whilst on this vacation, but we shall see! I shall attack my TBR with full force when I return to my home town. 😁
~
Also, I have yet to do a review for ACOWAR. I don't know how to put my full feelings into words yet. 💔🖤 I have just a bunch of random thoughts jotted down. Anyone else have/had this problem? 😭
